title: China’s Xi defends multilateralism at APEC after striking deal with Trump
summary: Beijing is positioning itself as defender of free trade as US tariffs disrupt global economy and Trump skips summit.

title: ‘No mercy’: Sudan soldier tells of escape from RSF slaughter in el-Fasher
summary: Thousands of civilians remain trapped in Sudan's el-Fasher, many of them hiding from RSF fighters.

title: Thousands march in Serbia to mark deadly train station collapse a year ago
summary: Youth are marching from Belgrade to join a rally in the country's north as Serbia's political crisis deepens.

title: Five things you should know about Mexico’s Day of the Dead
summary: Between skulls and marigold flowers, here is the significance of the Day of the Dead.

title: Death toll from Hurricane Melissa climbs to 49, with many still missing
summary: Haiti reported the highest number of deaths following catastrophic flooding from hurricane rains.

title: LIVE: Israel bombs south Gaza as Palestinians live ceasefire without peace
summary: Hamas hands over two more bodies of Israeli captives as Palestinians wonder if truce will hold.

title: LIVE: Australia vs India – second T20 international
summary: Follow our live build-up, with toss and team news, ahead of our full text commentary stream of the World Cup warm-up.

title: Trump calls for Senate to scrap filibuster tactic to end the gov’t shutdown
summary: The US president called for Republicans to go for the 'Nuclear Option' in order to end the Democratic Senate roadblock.

title: Iran condemns Trump’s call to resume US nuclear testing
summary: Tehran rebukes US plans for nuclear tests, citing hypocrisy over peaceful nuclear programme accusations.

title: Radio Free Asia says halting news operations due to Trump admin cuts
summary: Announcing the move, staff at the outlet said 'authoritarian regimes are already celebrating' its potential demise.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,345
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,345 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Trump administration sets rules to bar groups it opposes from loan relief
summary: Advocates say new rules let Education Department to politically punish groups working on immigration, transgender care.

title: Depuis la guerre de 12 jours avec Israël, une répression accrue est observée en Iran
summary: Une Mission indépendante de l'ONU s'inquiète, jeudi, d'une hausse de la répression en Iran consécutive aux frappes israéliennes de juin, alertant sur le sort des personnes arrêtées, notamment des journalistes et des minorités, lors de la guerre. "Un regain qui reflète une tendance récurrente", déplore la présidente de la mission.

title: Les juifs ultra-orthodoxes massivement mobilisés à Jérusalem contre la conscription
summary: À l'appel des partis ultra-orthodoxes Judaïsme unifié de la Torah et Shass, des dizaines de milliers de manifestants se sont rassemblés, jeudi, à Jérusalem pour réclamer le rétablissement d'un arrangement qui exemptait du service militaire les étudiants des écoles talmudiques, avant son invalidation par la Cour suprême israélienne.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne a récupéré et identifié les corps de deux otages
summary: Israël a identifié les restes des otages Amiram Kuper et Sahar Baruch, dont les corps ont été rendus par le Hamas plus tôt dans la journée. Le Hamas palestinien avait déjà remis les restes de 15 des 28 corps qui auraient dû être rendus au début de la trêve.

title: The Guardian révèle l'existence d'un accord secret entre Amazon, Google et Israël
summary: À la Une de la presse ce jeudi : les révélations du Guardian sur un accord secret entre deux géants du numérique, Amazon et Google, et le gouvernement israélien concernant la divulgation d'informations confidentielles ; l'état des lieux accablant sur la sécurité des musées en France après le casse du Louvre ; la présentation d'un robot humanoïde bientôt disponible dans les foyers du monde entier et la pression des autorités russes contre la fête "satanique" d'Halloween.

title: Au Liban, le président Aoun demande à l'armée de "s'opposer à toute incursion israélienne"
summary: Le président libanais, Joseph Aoun, a demandé, jeudi, à "l'armée de faire face à toute incursion israélienne (...) pour défendre le territoire libanais et la sécurité des citoyens", après la mort d'un employé municipal dans le sud du pays.

title: Guerre à Gaza : un cessez-le-feu chancelant
summary: Moins de trois semaines après l'entrée en vigueur du cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza, l'armée israélienne a mené de nouveaux raids sur l'enclave palestinienne, tuant au moins 100 personnes. Des frappes déclenchées après la mort d'un soldat israélien qu'Israël impute au Hamas – qui dément toute responsabilité. Le mouvement islamiste et l'État hébreu s'accusent mutuellement d'avoir violé la trêve.

title: Guerre à Gaza : un cycle sans fin ?
summary: Plus de 100 personnes sont mortes, mercredi, dans des bombardements israéliens, selon la Défense civile de Gaza. Alors que le Hamas et l’État hébreu s’accusent toujours mutuellement d’avoir violé la trêve, Israël a annoncé "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après ces violentes frappes. De son côté, le président américain Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l’accord de paix qu’il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas.

title: Gaza : Israël dit reprendre le cessez-le-feu après des frappes ayant fait plus de 100 morts
summary: La Défense civile et les hôpitaux de Gaza ont annoncé mercredi la mort de plus de cent personnes, dont de nombreux enfants, dans des bombardements israéliens. Israël a dit "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après ces frappes. Malgré ces violences, le président Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l'accord de cessez-le-feu qu'il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas. Retrouvez le fil de la journée du 29 octobre.

title: Israël lance des frappes sur Gaza, le Hamas dément toute attaque sur les troupes israéliennes
summary: Israël a mené des frappes meurtrières dans la bande de Gaza, mardi, entrainant la mort d'au moins 30 personnes, selon La Défense civile opérant sous l'autorité du Hamas. Plus tôt, Benjamin Netanyahu a accusé le Hamas de violer la trêve. Ce dernier dément toute attaque sur des soldats israéliens et "réaffirme son engagement envers l'accord de cessez-le-feu".

title: Gaza : la dernière restitution de dépouille d'otage met le cessez-le-feu en péril, selon Israël
summary: Au lendemain de la restitution par le Hamas d'une dépouille d'otage israélien, Israël affirme mardi que ces "restes humains" appartiennent déjà à un corps d'otage rendu. Et accuse le groupe islamiste palestinien de violation de leur accord de cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza.

title: Liban : l'ONU et la France dénoncent des tirs israéliens près de Casques bleus de la Finul
summary: L'ONU et la France affirment qu'un drone israélien a largué, dimanche au Liban, une grenade à proximité d'une patrouille de la Finul. Elles accusent également un char israélien d'avoir tiré sur des Casques bleus. Israël explique avoir riposté après que les forces de la Finul ont abattu un de ses drones de renseignement.

title: Liban : désarmement du Hezbollah, frappes israéliennes et drones
summary: Serge Berberi, notre correspondant à Beyrouth, analyse la situation.

title: Une revue sur l’espionnage qui confronte la légende à la réalité
summary: La « Revue de recherche sur le renseignement », lancée au début de l’année, sort son troisième numéro, où elle se penche notamment sur plusieurs affaires emblématiques et sur le rapport entre espions, secret et fictions.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : Israël a identifié les deux dépouilles mortelles d’otages rendues jeudi
summary: Sahar Baruch, 25 ans, avait été enlevé par le Hamas au kibboutz Beeri le 7 octobre 2023 et emmené à Gaza, où il a été tué lors d’une opération de sauvetage ratée de l’armée deux mois plus tard. Amiram Kuper, âgé de 84 ans au moment de son enlèvement, avait été kidnappé avec sa femme Nourit dans leur maison du kibboutz Nir Oz. Israël avait annoncé sa mort en captivité en juin 2024.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : le point sur la situation
summary: L’ONU a dénoncé jeudi les frappes russes contre les infrastructures énergétiques ukrainiennes : « Si des attaques de cette ampleur se poursuivent, il existe un risque important de conséquences dangereuses pour les civils cet hiver. » Plus de 700 missiles et drones ont été tirés mercredi soir, selon l’armée de l’air ukrainienne, tuant huit personnes.

title: Reprise des essais nucléaires : l’annonce retentissante mais floue de Donald Trump
summary: Le président américain n’a pas précisé s’il évoquait une intensification des tests de missiles ou de têtes nucléaires, qui placeraient les Etats-Unis en violation du Traité d’interdiction complète des essais nucléaires de 1996.

title: Au Sénégal, Dakar « décolonise » ses plaques de rue
summary: Le conseil municipal du Plateau, centre historique et administratif de la capitale, a décidé de rebaptiser ses artères les plus emblématiques. Mais seuls des noms de dignitaires masculins du pays ont été choisis, suscitant l’incompréhension des femmes et de certains historiens.

title: L’Allemagne et le Royaume-Uni renforcent leurs liens militaires avec la Turquie, malgré la dérive autoritaire du pouvoir
summary: L’achat pour une valeur de 9 milliards d’euros de 20 avions Eurofighter à Londres et les déclarations du chancelier allemand sur une coopération sécuritaire « plus étroite », lors de sa visite en Turquie, signent le retour en grâce d’un pays aux prises avec une situation démocratique dégradée.

title: Pourquoi Israël tarde à lever le blocus médiatique sur Gaza
summary: Après deux ans de guerre, l’ouverture possible de l’enclave palestinienne à la presse internationale va permettre de documenter l’ampleur des destructions et les possibles crimes commis lors des opérations de l’armée israélienne.

title: Australie : un accord inédit signé par l’Etat de Victoria en faveur de la reconnaissance officielle des peuples autochtones
summary: Le texte prévoit la création d’une assemblée consultative d’élus autochtones dans l’Etat de Victoria et la formation d’un organe consultatif chargé d’éliminer les inégalités en matière de santé.

title: Lettonie : les députés votent pour la sortie de la convention d’Istanbul sur la prévention des violences faites aux femmes
summary: L’opposition de droite portait ce texte, contre l’avis du président letton et de la majorité des formations composant la coalition gouvernementale. Si elle est approuvée par le chef de l’Etat, cette décision fera du pays le premier membre de l’UE à quitter la convention.

title: Les Etats-Unis réduisent drastiquement l’accueil des réfugiés, privilégiant les Afrikaners
summary: Seules 7 500 personnes pourront bénéficier du droit d’asile en 2025, contre environ 100 000 par an sous l’administration Biden. Les Blancs d’Afrique du Sud représenteront la majeure partie des personnes accueillies.

title: En Europe, les inquiétudes économiques se résorbent légèrement
summary: La croissance en zone euro a été de 0,2 % au troisième trimestre. La Banque centrale européenne estime que les incertitudes internationales commencent à se réduire.

title: Affaire Epstein : Charles III a amorcé un « processus formel » pour retirer ses titres au prince Andrew
summary: Buckingham a fait savoir, jeudi, que le prince Andrew, mis en cause pour ses liens avec le financier américain Jeffrey Epstein, « sera désormais connu sous le nom d’Andrew Mountbatten Windsor » et qu’il quittera sa résidence royale.

title: Israel arrests five Palestinians in dawn raids in the occupied West Bank
summary:
Israel arrests five Palestinians in dawn raids in the occupied West Bank

Israeli occupation forces raided the occupied West Bank city of Qalqilya at dawn, arresting five young men after storming several neighbourhoods, according to the Palestinian news agency Wafa

Local residents said Israeli troops entered from the city’s southern gate and spread through Al-Naqqar and the streets of Jaljulia and Nablus before detaining Firas Hassain, Saleh Sawi, Mo’men Jabara, Muhammad Abed and Ayman Hajjar.

Homes were ransacked and searched during the arrests, part of Israel’s ongoing campaign of intimidation and repression across the occupied territories.

title: Israel kills three Palestinians as ceasefire violations escalate
summary:
Israel kills three Palestinians as ceasefire violations escalate

Israeli forces killed three Palestinians across the Gaza Strip, including one who died from wounds sustained in an earlier air raid, in yet another breach of the fragile ceasefire.

Overnight, Israeli troops demolished several homes east of Gaza City and Khan Younis, triggering massive explosions that echoed through the night.

Meanwhile, Israeli warships unleashed heavy gunfire off the coast of Gaza City, further undermining the already crumbling truce.

title: Unrwa shelters displaced Palestinians as Israel intensifies attacks
summary:
Unrwa shelters displaced Palestinians as Israel intensifies attacks

The United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (Unrwa) said thousands of displaced Palestinians have sought safety in its schools, which have been turned into makeshift shelters amid Israel’s relentless bombardment of Gaza.

The agency stressed that despite severe shortages and constant Israeli attacks, it remains the backbone of humanitarian efforts in the besieged enclave. Unrwa vowed to continue providing aid and protection to civilians enduring what it described as catastrophic conditions even as the US and Israel have demanded that it not play a role in post war Gaza.

title: Israel pounds eastern Khan Younis with heavy shelling and air raids
summary:
Israel pounds eastern Khan Younis with heavy shelling and air raids

Israeli forces have unleashed intense artillery and air strikes on eastern Khan Younis since the early hours of the morning, according to Al Jazeera reporters on the ground.

The occupation army carried out at least four large-scale demolition operations east of Khan Younis, with further destruction reported on the outskirts of Gaza City, part of Israel’s ongoing campaign to obliterate what remains of Gaza’s infrastructure and civilian life.

title: Israel expands illegal settlements with 48,000 new housing units
summary:
Israel expands illegal settlements with 48,000 new housing units

Israel’s Yedioth Ahronoth newspaper has reported that Benjamin Netanyahu’s government has built or approved around 48,000 settlement housing units since taking office, a figure expected to rise to 50,000.

The figures expose the regime’s relentless expansion of illegal settlements across the occupied West Bank, deepening the theft of Palestinian land in defiance of international law and repeated global condemnation.

title: Palestinian man dies from wounds after Israeli strike on Al-Mawasi camp
summary:
Palestinian man dies from wounds after Israeli strike on Al-Mawasi camp

A Palestinian man has died from injuries he sustained in an earlier Israeli air strike that hit a tent sheltering displaced families in Al-Mawasi, west of Khan Younis in southern Gaza, Al Jazeera Arabic reported.

The victim had been critically wounded in the strike, which targeted one of the few areas Israel had previously labelled a “safe zone”.

title: Palestinian teen dies after Israeli troops block his evacuation
summary:
Palestinian teen dies after Israeli troops block his evacuation

A 15-year-old Palestinian boy has died after Israeli soldiers shot him and blocked medics from reaching him in the occupied West Bank town of Silwad, east of Ramallah.

Witnesses told the Palestinian news agency Wafa that the child, Yamin Samed Hamed, was left bleeding on the ground for a long time as Israeli forces refused to let ambulances approach.

He was eventually taken to a government hospital in Ramallah but succumbed to his injuries soon after.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war on Gaza, now in its 755th day:

  • The Palestinian group Hamas has returned the bodies of two Israeli captives, saying they died in detention. The handover comes just a day after Israel shattered the fragile truce with a new wave of deadly air raids across the besieged Gaza Strip.

  • Israeli forces carried out fresh attacks on four locations in southern Lebanon, wounding several people, according to Lebanese media. The newspaper Al Akhbar reported that an Israeli tank briefly crossed into Lebanese territory near the town of Aitaroun.

  • Lebanese President Joseph Aoun has ordered troops to be deployed along the southern border to “defend Lebanese sovereignty” from ongoing Israeli incursions, Al Mayadeen reported.

  • In the occupied West Bank, two American Jewish women are facing deportation from Israel after joining an interfaith delegation for the annual olive harvest, which has seen settlers violently attacking Palestinians under the protection of Israeli forces.

  • Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan accused Germany of turning a blind eye to what he called Israel’s “genocide” and “deliberate starvation” of Palestinians in Gaza. Speaking alongside German Chancellor Friedrich Merz in Ankara, Erdogan condemned Berlin’s continued support for Israel despite the mounting civilian death toll.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

- The Red Cross has handed over the bodies of two Israeli captives to the Israeli army and Shin Bet, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office has confirmed.

- A Red Cross spokesperson said that Israel must allow access to all Palestinian prisoners in its custody, Al Jazeera reported. Israel’s Defense Minister Israel Katz has officially barred the International Committee of the Red Cross from visiting Palestinians held under Israel’s so-called “unlawful combatants” law, a legal category that does not exist under international law

- The Washington Post on Thursday said it has obtained a classified US government report that points to "many hundreds" of Israeli human rights violations in Gaza, but that the backlog of these incidents is so great that it would take the State Department “multiple years” to review each one.

- A French team of military and civilian personnel has been sent to Israel to help plan Gaza's post-ceasefire phase, French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot has announced.

- Israeli forces have shot dead a 14-year-old Palestinian boy in the town of Silwad in Ramallah, in the occupied West Bank, local reports said. The victim has been identified as Yamen Samed Hammad. 

- Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan criticised Germany over what he said was its ignorance of Israel's genocide, famine and attacks in Gaza, at a joint news conference with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz in Ankara.

- The Lebanese health ministry said on Thursday that three people have been wounded after Israeli air strikes targeted Shaba'a in southern Lebanon. Just hours prior, a municipal worker was shot to death by Israeli soldiers who stormed a local government building in Blida.

title: Israel kills 14-year-old Palestinian in Ramallah
summary:
Israel kills 14-year-old Palestinian in Ramallah

Israeli forces have shot dead a 14-year-old Palestinian boy on Thursday in the town of Silwad in Ramallah, in the occupied West Bank, local reports said. 

The victim has been identified as Yamen Samed Hammad.

title: US senator suggests that killing of Lebanese civilians is necessary collateral
summary:
US senator suggests that killing of Lebanese civilians is necessary collateral

US Republican Senator and staunch ally of President Donald Trump, Lindsey Graham, suggested on Thursday that the killing of Lebanese civilians by Israel is necessary collateral in the fight against Hezbollah.

"To my friends in Lebanon, I understand being upset when innocent people are killed or harmed by Israeli military operations designed to suppress Hezbollah, a historical threat to the State of Israel," Graham wrote on X.

"However, I firmly believe that Israel’s military incursions into Lebanon are designed to suppress the reemergence of Hezbollah - a radical, Islamic terrorist organization tied to Iran that has been threatening and attacking Israelis, Americans, and Lebanese for decades," he added.

"If Hezbollah were disarmed, Israel’s military actions would cease. There have been encouraging statements coming from Lebanon about the desire to disarm Hezbollah, turning over all weapons to the Lebanese military. These statements need to be acted upon in a real way. The idea of the Lebanese military joining forces with Hezbollah to combat Israel would put in jeopardy everything that I and many others are trying to do to help Lebanon move forward".

title: US government document points to hundreds of Israeli human rights violations in Gaza: Report
summary:
US government document points to hundreds of Israeli human rights violations in Gaza: Report

The Washington Post on Thursday said it has obtained a classified US government report that points to "many hundreds" of Israeli human rights violations in Gaza, but that the backlog of these incidents is so great that it would take the State Department “multiple years” to review each one.

The two unnamed officials who spoke to the Post said it wll be difficult to hold Israel accountable as a result, and that the review process itself is "deferential to the Israel Defense Forces".

title: Slovak president stresses necessity of diplomatic ties with Iran
summary: Tehran, IRNA — The President of the Slovak Republic, Peter Pellegrini, has emphasized the necessity of maintaining diplomatic and friendly relations with all countries, including the Islamic Republic.

title: Russia vows to continue close cooperation with Iran in Middle East
summary: Moscow, IRNA— Russia’s Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova has announced Moscow’s readiness to continue close and constructive cooperation with the Islamic Republic in the Middle East.

title: Araghchi condemns US nuclear weapons testing resumption as a global threat
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has issued a warning in response to Washington's announcement to resume nuclear weapons testing, calling it a regressive and irresponsible move.

title: Iranian deputy foreign minister and UN special envoy discuss Yemen
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Deputy Foreign Minister for Political Affairs Majid Takht--Ravanchi has met and held talks with UN Special Envoy for Yemen Hans Grundberg in Muscat on Thursday.

title: Passive defense underpins infrastructural resilience, social stability: Iran’s top general
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Chairman of the Chief of Staff of Iran’s Armed Forces Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi says that passive defense is the backbone of the country’s infrastructural resilience and social stability.

title: Iran’s alignment of diplomatic and military fronts has deterred its enemies: Araghchi
summary: Tabriz, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has said that diplomacy is an integral part of Iran’s defensive power, adding that the alignment between the country’s military and diplomatic fronts played a decisive role in deterring adversaries.

title: Iran, Oman stress need to resolve conflicts through dialogue and peaceful means
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Political Affairs Majid Takht Ravanchi and Oman’s Foreign Minister Badr bin Hamad Albusaidi have held the eleventh round of political consultations between the two countries, emphasizing the significance of resolving conflicts through dialogue.

title: Iranian envoy, Nigerien minister discuss tourism cooperation
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Iranian ambassador to the Republic of Niger has met with the African country’s minister of tourism and handicrafts to discuss bilateral cooperation on tourism.

title: Iran ready for fair and respectful talks if other parties are prepared too: FM Araghchi
summary: Tabriz, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Iran is ready for constructive negotiations if the other sides are also prepared for fair and respectful talks.

title: IAEA chief fully aware of peaceful nature of Iran’s nuclear program: Spokesperson
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei says that Rafael Grossi, the Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), is completely aware of the peaceful nature of Iran's nuclear program.

title: Iran strongly condemns ongoing Israeli attacks on defenseless Gazans
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei has categorically condemned the Israeli regime’s unrelenting airstrikes on various areas in the south, center, and north of the Gaza Strip.

title: Belarus says determined to deepen relations with Iran
summary: Moscow, IRNA – Belarusian Foreign Minister Maxim Ryzhenkov has reaffirmed his country’s firm resolve to expand and deepen relations with Iran across various fields, describing President Masoud Pezeshkian’s recent visit to Minsk as a success.

title: Palestinian teenager killed during Israeli raid in Silwad
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) - A 15-year-old Palestinian boy, Yamen Samed Hamed, was killed last night, shot during a raid by Israeli forces east of Ramallah.

title: Iranian, Yemeni officials discuss implementing peace roadmap
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – High-ranking officials from Iran and Yemen discussed the implementation of peace roadmap plan.

title: Teen dies in Haredi settlers’ protest in al-Quds
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – In a massive demonstration by extremist settlers known as "Haredis" in the occupied al-Quds against compulsory military service, one of them was killed and an Israeli policeman was injured.

summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – Four new books introduce children to Martyr Hossein Fahmideh, the 13-year-old hero of the Sacred Defense. The publications aim to inspire youth with his enduring story of sacrifice and valor.

summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – Russia successfully tested a nuclear-powered underwater Poseidon drone on Tuesday, Putin revealed. The following is the latest information about the torpedo, which is more like a sea drone.

title: Iran lands in fourth place at 2025 Asian Youth Games
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – Iran's young athletes have wrapped up a remarkable campaign at the third edition of the Asian Youth Games, securing fourth place in the overall standings with 22 gold, 18 silver, and 36 bronze medals.

title: Iran in past week; Key developments at home and abroad
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – Here is a concise weekly digest of the most significant political, economic, cultural, and social developments in Iran, published every Friday by Mehr News Agency.

title: Passive defense needs to be incorporated in national planning
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – The Chief of Staff of the Iranian Armed Forces emphasized that given the lessons of the 12-day war, it is essential to effectively incorporate passive defense into national planning.

title: 10 beautiful cities you should visit during travel to Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 31 (MNA) – Iran stands out as a land where urban life is deeply intertwined with centuries of history, spirituality, and stunning natural diversity.

title: Afghanistan, Pakistan agree to continue ceasefire
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – Pakistan and the Afghanistan have agreed to maintain ceasefire following a fresh round of talks in Istanbul, confirmed Turkiye’s foreign ministry on late Thursday.

title: اژدری: توسعه گردشگری روستایی از اولویت های استان کرمان است
summary: کرمان- مدیر کل دفتر امور روستایی استانداری کرمان گفت: توسعه گردشگری روستایی و ایجاد صنایع تبدیلی در صدر اولویت‌های این استان قرار دارند.

title: همایش پیشگیری از خودکشی در استان بوشهر برگزار شد
summary: بوشهر- نخستین سمپوزیوم پیشگیری از خودکشی در بوشهر با ابتکار سازمان نظام روانشناسی و مشاوره استان بوشهر، برگزار شد.

title: ماجرای گزینش پرستاران در دیدار با پزشکیان + فیلم
summary: برگزاری مراسم روز پرستار با حضور رئیس جمهوری در مرکز همایش‌های صداوسیما، با حواشی همراه بود.

title: حداقل ۲۰ کشته در پی توفان «ملیسا» در هائیتی
summary: رسانه‌ها روز جمعه گزارش دادند که حداقل ۲۰ نفر در هائیتی در پی توفان ملیسا جان خود را از دست داده‌اند.

title: تصادف جاده‌ای در شرق افغانستان ۳ کشته و ۱۸ زخمی برجای گذاشت
summary: دفتر پلیس استان لغمان در بیانیه‌ای روز جمعه اعلام کرد که در اثر برخورد یک تراکتور و دو دستگاه خودروی سواری در استان لغمان در شرق افغانستان، حداقل ۳ نفر کشته و ۱۸ نفر دیگر زخمی شدند.

title: یونیفل: تجاوز اسرائیل به «بلیدا» نقض قطعنامه ۱۷۰۱ و حاکمیت لبنان است
summary: نیروهای حافظ صلح سازمان ملل در جنوب لبنان ضمن ابراز نگرانی عمیق از تجاوز رژیم صهیونیستی به شهرک بلیدا، این اقدام را نقض حاکمیت لبنان و قطعنامه ۱۷۰۱ شورای امنیت سازمان ملل توصیف کردند.
